arts.ttl: Burnley man eyed by European pair ahead of January
arts.sum: Burnley midfielder Josh Brownhill has emerged on the radar of Fiorentina and Lazio, according to a report by… The post Burnley man eyed by European pair ahead of January appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Michael Carrick's challenge to his Middlesbrough players as he takes key factor from Burnley draw
arts.sum: Michael Carrick takes a lot of encouragement from Middlesbrough’s defensive display in Sunday evening’s draw with Burnley, and has now challenged his players to do it on a more consistent basis. But hoping to kick on in the second half of the season, Carrick now wants to see his players find those levels week in and week out.

arts.ttl: Burnley player ratings vs Middlesbrough as 8/10 and two 5/10s handed out after stalemate - gallery
arts.sum: Burnley’s 2024 drew to a close with a goalless draw against Middlesbrough as Scott Parker’s men gave up the chance to finish the year in the top two.

arts.ttl: Cruel Sol Brynn Middlesbrough injury blow confirmed with rough timeframe on return
arts.sum: Confirming the injury blow after the Burnley draw, Boro boss Michael Carrick said: “It’s not great with Sol. He’s going to be out for three months at least. Sol Brynn faces around three months out after dislocating his shoulder in Middlesbrough ’s Boxing Day draw with Sheffield Wednesday.

arts.ttl: Scott Parker's immediate reaction to Burnley's stalemate against Middlesbrough in final game of 2024
arts.sum: Scott Parker has spoken of his pride at how his Burnley side have navigated a tiring festive schedule following their goalless draw against Middlesbrough.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough end 2024 in the play-off places in a more disciplined performance in Burnley draw
arts.sum: James Trafford made the best save of the game to deny Finn Azaz in the second half, while stand-in Tom Glover should have at least been worked when Burnley carved open Boro only for Josh Brownhill to fire over from close-range as both sides had to settle for the point. Against a good Burnley side who were playing to end the calendar year in the automatic promotion places, Boro were cautiously looking to hit Burnley on the counter, with Delano Burgzorg’s driving runs down the left dangerous but lacking an end product for much of the first half.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough 0-0 Burnley: Unbeaten run continues as Clarets rue Josh Brownhill miss
arts.sum: Burnley and Middlesbrough were unable to be separated for the second time in the space of three weeks as the Clarets extended their unbeaten run to 11.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough and Burnley share points from Championship stalemate at Riverside
arts.sum: Jaidon Anthony and Delano Burgzorg impressed but neither could score.

arts.ttl: Jeremy Sarmiento returns to Burnley bench as Scott Parker names starting XI for Middlesbrough clash
arts.sum: Burnley have named an unchanged side for the third straight game for tonight’s clash against Middlesbrough.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough sent Isaiah Jones transfer message amid January exit talk
arts.sum: Despite the fact that Jones remains a well-used part of the Boro squad this season, regularly coming off the bench to play his part, he's started only one game since September and that's led to some reports that he is unsettled on Teesside and would like to leave in the January transfer window in search of more game-time. Former Middlesbrough midfielder Ray Parlour believes his former club should look to retain Isaiah Jones in next month's transfer window, amid talk of the player wanting an exit.
